intro: Erigeron eatonii var. nevadincola, commonly known as the Nevada fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are generally narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture, and the plant is often found in arid environments.
